author: kfogel
msg: (write_entry_xml): Don't bother to write out depth, clients that
read this entries format wouldn't know what to do with it anyway.

author: kfogel
msg: Make depth parameters optional in the svn:// protocol in a cleaner way,
and document the depth parameters in the first place (as should have
Note: This is similar to r23760, but the reason lundblad didn't do
these as well in r23760 is that these depth parameters will probably
go away when we implement lundblad's suggestion about how to set
But, one step at a time.  These are easy corrections, and while I'm
now pretty sure about the "set-path and link-path are all we need"
approach, I'm not 100% positive yet.  In the meantime, bad protocol
is the devil's playground, so let's make it nicer.
(update, switch_cmd, status, diff): Make depth an optional raw word,
not an optional tuple with an optional word inside.
(3.1.1. Main Command Set): Document depth parameter

author: kfogel
msg: Follow up to r6911 and r6914 with a doc fix:
(3.1.1. Main Command Set): Document the new doubly-optional rev

author: malcolm
msg: On the sparse-directories branch: revert an unnecessary svnserve change for
(diff): If we've only been sent five parameters, we won't have the depth
word by definition, so set it to NULL explicitly.
